p: Much of Africa is predicted to currently be at least marginally suitable for transmission year-round ( Fig. 2b), whereas much of Central Africa is in the most suitable quantile year-round ( Fig. 2a). This closely matches independent predictions by Mapping Malaria Risk in Africa (MARA) (Tanser et al. 2003) and Malaria Atlas Project (MAP) (Gething et al. 2010, 2011).
